ca.eandb.jmist.framework.scatter

Class BioSpecSurfaceScatterer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.eandb.jmist.framework.scatter.BioSpecSurfaceScatterer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SurfaceScatterer, Serializable

    public final class BioSpecSurfaceScatterer
extends Object
implements SurfaceScatterer
    A SurfaceScatterer implementing the BioSpec algorithm.

    The algorithm implemented here is described in:

    A. Krishnaswamy, G.V.G. Baranoski, A biophysically-based spectral model of light interaction with human skin, In Computer Graphics Forum 23(3):331-340, 2004.
    Author:
    Brad Kimmel
    See Also:
    Run BioSpec Online, Serialized Form

      • Fields inherited from interface ca.eandb.jmist.framework.scatter.SurfaceScatterer

      • scatter

        public Vector3 scatter(SurfacePointGeometry x,
                       Vector3 v,
                       boolean adjoint,
                       double lambda,
                       Random rnd)
        Description copied from interface: SurfaceScatterer
        Simulates surface scattering.
        Specified by:
        scatter in interface SurfaceScatterer
        Parameters:
        x - The SurfacePointGeometry describing the geometry at the point on the surface to which the light is incident.
        v - The Vector3 indicating the incident direction.
        adjoint - A value indicating whether ray tracing is proceeding backwards (i.e., from the eye).
        lambda - The wavelength of the incident light (in meters).
        rnd - The Random number generator to use.
        Returns:
        A Vector3 indicating the direction of scattering, or null if the ray is absorbed.
